intro: Waltheria pohliana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple and blue. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is characterized by its rapid growth habit. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The flowers bloom in the early morning, hence its common name, and are pollinated by birds and insects.
